SEARCH
Package examblock.model

Interface StreamManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
Exam, ExamList, ListManager, Room, RoomList, Session, SessionList, Student, StudentList, Subject, SubjectList, Unit, UnitList, Venue, VenueList
public interface StreamManager
This class provides an interface to stream data to and from disk. It use replaces the static data in the Catalogue class in A1

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    streamIn(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem)
    Used to read data from the disk.
    void
    streamOut(BufferedWriter bw, int nthItem)
    Used to write data to the disk.

    The format of the text written to the stream must be matched exactly by streamIn, so it is very important to format the output as described.

    For example

  • Method Details

    • streamOut

      void streamOut(BufferedWriter bw, int nthItem) throws IOException
      Used to write data to the disk.

      The format of the text written to the stream must be matched exactly by streamIn, so it is very important to format the output as described.

      For example

      Parameters:
      bw - writer, already opened. Your data should be written at the current file position
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues

    • streamIn

      void streamIn(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Used to read data from the disk. IOExceptions and RuntimeExceptions must be allowed to propagate out to the calling method, which co-ordinates the streaming. Any other exceptions should be converted to RuntimeExceptions and rethrown.

      For the format of the text in the input stream, refer to the streamOut documentation.
      Parameters:
      br - reader, already opened
      registry - the global object registry
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues
      RuntimeException - on any logic related issues
